clusters.title: Man dies after truck, car crash, burst into flame in Queensland
clusters.neutral_headline: Man Dies in Queensland Traffic Crash

items.title: Man dies after truck, car crash, burst into flame in Queensland
items.standfirst: E mergency services were called to the scene on the New England Highway in the Darling Downs yesterday evening.
items.content: A man has died after a truck and car collided on Queensland's Darling Downs.Emergency services were called to the New England Highway near The Summit after reports a Mack truck and a Mitsubishi Pajero had crashed.Both vehicles were knocked off the road and caught fire.READ MORE: Sunny start to the week before chill, rain returns The driver and sole occupant of the Mitsubishi, a 60-year-old Collingwood Park man, died at the scene.The driver and sole occupant of the truck, a 65-year-old man from New South Wales, sustained minor injuries.An investigation into the crash is ongoing. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. clusters.title: Investigators looking into potential motives, radicalisation of alleged Kirk shooter
clusters.neutral_headline: Investigators Examine Motives in Alleged Kirk Shooting
bullet_summary: "Those are things that are still being processed for accuracy and verification and will be included in charging documents," Utah's governor said

items.title: Investigators looking into potential motives, radicalisation of alleged Kirk shooter
items.standfirst: Utah Governor Spencer Cox has opened up about potential motives of the alleged Charlie Kirk shooter, pointing to gaming and "dark internet" culture as potential factors.
items.content: Utah Governor Spencer Cox has opened up about potential motives of the alleged Charlie Kirk shooter, pointing to gaming and "dark internet" culture as potential factors.Meanwhile, investigators are also looking into if the fact the roommate of Tyler Robinson, Kirk's alleged shooter, was a romantic partner of Robinson and transitioning from male to female, was a factor in last week's assassination."Yes. I can confirm that. I know that has been reported, and that the FBI has confirmed that as well – that the roommate was a romantic partner, a male transitioning to female," Cox said in an interview with CNN's Dana Bash on State of the Union.READ MORE: 'Note' left by Charlie Kirk shooting suspect under investigation The roommate, Cox added, "has been incredibly cooperative, had no idea that this was happening, and is working with investigators right now".Asked by Bash whether the roommate's status was relevant to the investigation and a potential motive, Cox said it was "easy to draw conclusions" but declined to speculate."I know everybody wants to know exactly why, and point the finger. And I totally get that," Cox said.READ MORE: Massive fireball erupts as Israeli missiles strike Gaza high-rises "I do too, and so I just want to be careful, as I haven't read all of the interview transcripts, and so we'll have to wait and see what comes out."Cox further elaborated on how investigators have determined that Robinson had been radicalized, pointing to gaming and "dark internet" culture as potential factors that contributed to a shift.Cox suggested things changed for Robinson after he dropped out of Utah State University."It seemed to happen kind of after that — after he moved back to the southern part of Utah. Clearly, there was a lot of gaming going on, friends that have confirmed that there was kind of that deep, dark internet, Reddit culture and these other dark places of the internet where this person was going deep. You saw that on the casings. … the meme-ification that is happening in our society today," he told NBC.In an interview with ABC's "This Week" with Martha Raddatz, Cox also confirmed reports that acquaintances were joking online with Robinson about photos released by the FBI during the manhunt."Those conversations definitely were happening. And they did not believe it was actually him — it was all joking until he admitted that it actually was him," he said.Official charges, Cox said, will be filed tomorrow.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.title: 'Note' left by Charlie Kirk shooting suspect under investigation
items.standfirst: "Those are things that are still being processed for accuracy and verification and will be included in charging documents," Utah's governor said.
items.content: Investigators are looking into a note left by Tyler Robinson, the alleged shooter of Charlie Kirk, Utah Governor Spencer Cox said overnight.Social and gaming platform Discord vice president Jud Hoffman said in a statement Friday that there were "communications between the suspect's roommate and a friend after the shooting where the roommate was recounting the contents of a note the suspect had left elsewhere".Cox appeared to confirm the existence of a note in an interview with CNN's Dana Bash on State of the Union, but indicated it was still under review.READ MORE: Romania condemns 'irresponsible' Moscow after Russian drone breach "Those are things that are still being processed for accuracy and verification and will be included in charging documents," Cox said.Pressed by Bash on whether a note was found and its contents were known by law enforcement, he declined to share specifics.Robinson's messagesWhile police are still investigating the killing, authorities have pointed to what they described as anti-fascist messages engraved on bullet casings in a rifle found near the deadly shooting as potential evidence of a political motive.One bullet was inscribed with "Hey fascist! Catch!" – a message that Utah Governor Spencer Cox said Friday "speaks for itself."A family member of Robinson's told investigators that the suspected shooter "had become more political in recent years," and in particular had lashed out at Kirk at a recent family dinner, Cox said.READ MORE: People are getting fired for allegedly celebrating Charlie Kirk's murder. It looks like a coordinated effort But the messages on the bullet casings also included a mix of memes and allusions to video games, suggesting a deep immersion in an irony-soaked online world where meanings can be difficult to precisely decipher.Those messages included a series of arrows representing the controls used to carry out an attack in the video game Helldivers 2 and lyrics of a popular Italian song linked to anti-fascists – but also popularised more recently in another game, Far Cry 6, and a Netflix series. Several years ago in high school, Robinson – like his family – was politically conservative, and supported President Donald Trump ahead of the 2020 election, one of Robinson's former classmates told CNN.READ MORE: They witnessed Charlie Kirk's assassination. Now students reckon with the trauma "When I knew him and his family, they were like diehard Trump," said the former classmate."When this happened, I was like… I don't know what changed."Voter registration records show that Robinson is currently registered to vote unaffiliated with any party, although he never cast a ballot, the Washington County clerk said in a statement.The former classmate described Robinson as being "very, very big into gaming" and interested in video game design.Robinson and his friends "would spend their lunches playing the card games and all that kind of stuff," he said.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.content: A Darwin animal shelter has been accused of "unprofessional" behaviour after failing to provide desexing services which new owners had already paid for as part of their adoption fee.

ai_summary: A Darwin animal shelter is accused of unprofessional behavior.
The shelter failed to provide desexing services to new pet owners.
New owners had already paid for desexing as part of adoption fees.
The shelter's actions have drawn criticism from the community.
The shelter's practices are under scrutiny regarding animal welfare.

clusters.title: Trashed former hospital site hits market after years of decay
clusters.neutral_headline: Former Hospital Site in Moe Faces Decay, Potential Housing

items.title: Trashed former hospital site hits market after years of decay
items.standfirst: A retired nurse who worked at Moe Hospital says the closed facility could be used for housing rather than left to further rot.
items.content: A retired nurse who worked at Moe Hospital says the closed facility could be used for housing rather than left to further rot.

clusters.title: Understanding 'brain shrink' at Antarctica could help astronauts
clusters.neutral_headline: Antarctic Research Studies Brain Shrinkage in Expeditioners

items.title: Understanding 'brain shrink' at Antarctica could help astronauts
items.standfirst: Expeditioners at Australia's Antarctic stations are taking part in a research project to better understand the cognitive and physiological impacts of extended deployments — which can include actual "brain shrinkage".
items.content: Expeditioners at Australia's Antarctic stations are taking part in a research project to better understand the cognitive and physiological impacts of extended deployments — which can include actual "brain shrinkage".

ai_summary: Australian Antarctic stations are conducting research on brain shrinkage.
Expeditioners are participating in a project to understand cognitive impacts.
The research aims to study the physiological effects of extended deployments.
Extended deployments can lead to actual brain shrinkage in some individuals.
The research is focused on understanding the effects of isolation.

clusters.title: Rideshare drivers working up to 18 hours a day, union warns
clusters.neutral_headline: Rideshare Drivers Working Long Hours, Union Raises Concerns
bullet_summary: the Transport Workers' Union, some rideshare drivers have reported being on the road for up to 18 hours a day, swapping between multiple apps in order to bypass fatigue restrictions

items.title: Rideshare drivers working up to 18 hours a day, union warns
items.standfirst: According to the Transport Workers' Union, some rideshare drivers have reported being on the road for up to 18 hours a day, swapping between multiple apps in order to bypass fatigue restrictions.
items.content: According to the Transport Workers' Union, some rideshare drivers have reported being on the road for up to 18 hours a day, swapping between multiple apps in order to bypass fatigue restrictions.

The long hours are impacting the drivers' well-being.

clusters.title: Dads avoid sex talks with kids amid concern about online content
clusters.neutral_headline: Report Shows Dads Avoid Sex Talks with Children

items.title: Dads avoid sex talks with kids amid concern about online content
items.standfirst: New report finds mothers do more of the sex education at home, raising concerns that young boys are missing out on key information from their dads.
items.content: New report finds mothers do more of the sex education at home, raising concerns that young boys are missing out on key information from their dads.

clusters.title: Warmer weather tipped for much of Queensland as spring sets in
clusters.neutral_headline: Queensland Weather Forecasts Vary as Spring Begins

items.title: Warmer weather tipped for much of Queensland as spring sets in
items.standfirst: The southern half of Queensland can expect fine weather at least for the first half of the week, while more rain is on the way for the north of the state.
items.content: The southern half of Queensland can expect fine weather at least for the first half of the week, while more rain is on the way for the north of the state.

ai_summary: Southern Queensland can expect fine weather for the week's first half.
